tachirei - (06/07/2009 16:01): how do I convert this to XWiki 1.0 syntax: {{velocity}}$xwiki.ssx.use("XWiki.MyFirstStylesheetExtension"){{/velocity}} ? I'm afraid I don't understand it from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax  
tmortagne - (06/07/2009 16:03): tachirei: in XWiki 1.0 you are always in a mixed HTML/Velocity/Syntax context so you just need to remove the {{velocity}} and {{/velocity}}  
tachirei - (06/07/2009 16:04): ok. thanks! :)  
tmortagne - (06/07/2009 16:04): XWiki 1.0 is more or less like a content between {{velocity}}{{html wiki="true" clean="false"}} and {{/html}}{{/velocity}} with some differences in syntaxes of headers etc...  
tmortagne left at 16:06 ("Ex-Chat")  
lucien joined #xwiki at 16:38  
tachirei - (06/07/2009 17:08): can a page have 2 ssx object: one on demand and one always? I tried it but it seems that all the ssx is in a single css resource, so the "on demand" ssx is included always also :-|  
tachirei - (06/07/2009 17:09): or "on demand" and "always" reffers to Style Sheet Extensions, and not for particular ssx objects?

mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:25): What does "isDiff: Archive is inconsistent. Text and diff field are contradicting" mean?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:25): What database are you using?  
guillaum1 left at 22:26 ("Leaving.")  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:26): I have done an export of a page to a \*.xar. And when I am importing it, I get this message.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:27): What database are you using?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:27): MySQL.  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:27): MySQL 5.0.83.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:27): And what connector?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:28): mysql-connector-java-5.1.7-bin.jar  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:28): The latest. The greatest?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:28): Hm, this is usually caused by using a 3.x connector with a 5.x database  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:28): I exported from an XWiki 1.0b3. And imported it into an XWiki 1.9.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:28): Which doesn't seem to be your case  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:29): Something went wrong with converting the history  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:30): Do you get this error if you write a new document and save several versions of it?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:30): The page in the \*.xar says <version>1.26</version>. After the import, the latest version in the history tab has 1.25.  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:31): sdumitriu: There is no error when creating a new page and modifying it.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:32): Then, how important is the history for you?  
guillaum1 joined #xwiki at 22:32  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:33): sdumitriu: 1.1 ... 1.25 is all there. But I am not sure if I am mussing the 1.26 revision which is annotated by the version tag in the \*.xar file.  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:35): sdumitriu: Do you know what I mean?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:35): Yes  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:36): There is a possibility  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:36): Older XWiki numbered versions starting from 1.2  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:36): While newer ones start from 1.1  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:36): (it was a bug)  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:36): So maybe the versions have been shifted  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:37): How many of the documents generate this error?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:38): 240.  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:39): Every page.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:39): So, how important is the history for you?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:39): The simple solution is to drop the xwikircs table and restart XWiki  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:39): The problem is not the history.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:40): Yes it is  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:40): If 1.26 is dropped. And 1.25 is used as the current page, then I lost the latest modifications.  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 22:48): Or is the version tag (<version>1.5</version>) in a page of a \*.xar the next revision number?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 22:55): mjmjmj, when do you get this error?   
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:00): When I am select an uploaded file to import. "Select the file you wish to import".  
cristinaS joined #xwiki at 23:12  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:16): The error message comes from http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/tags/xwiki-core-1.9/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/rcs/XWikiRCSArchive.java  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:16): The isDiff method. JavaDoc: "is this node store diff or full version".  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:46): sdumitriu: Which database are you using? PostgreSQL?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:46): None  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:48): XWiki without a database?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:49): No, I'm a developer, so I don't need to run a wiki  
marta\_\_ left at 23:50 ("ChatZilla 0.9.85 [Firefox 3.5/20090616212416]")  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:50): But during development?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:50): hsql  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:52): Are you using Eclipse with WTP to get hot code replacement? Or are you building and redeploying the whole war for each change?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:52): Mave with the Jetty plugin?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:52): Maven.  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:52): Maven  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:53): And you can change you struts action on the fly without a full redeployment?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:53): Yes  
arkub left at 23:54 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:55): Are you using Eclipse, IDEA or Vim?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:55): Eclipse  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:55): Emacs?  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:55): And m2eclipse?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:55): No, console maven  
mjmjmj - (06/07/2009 23:56): The Jetty plugin is watching Eclipse bin directory for changed class files?  
sdumitriu - (06/07/2009 23:58): No, I don't think so
